lessonTopics: Lesson 1: Pet Nutrition Foundations - What species-appropriate nutrition is, the problem with commercial pet food, 5 pillars of optimal pet nutrition, scope of practice
Lesson 2: The W.H.O.L.E. Method - Whole foods, Hydration, Organic sourcing, Label reading, Elimination diets framework for systematic pet nutrition consulting
Lesson 3: Getting Your First Clients - Pet parent community strategy, pricing packages, income math, 30-day launch plan
painPoints: Confused by pet food labels with ingredients they can't pronounce
Watching their fur baby struggle with allergies, digestive issues, or low energy
Vet keeps pushing prescription kibble but they feel there must be a better way
Want the best for their fur babies but don't know where to start
Lost a pet too young and feel guilty about what they fed them
Helping friends with pet nutrition for free but no professional framework or income
terminology: Species-appropriate diet - feeding pets foods aligned with their evolutionary biology and digestive systems
W.H.O.L.E. Method - Whole foods, Hydration, Organic sourcing, Label reading, Elimination diets framework
5 Pillars of Pet Nutrition - Protein quality, Moisture content, Ingredient transparency, Nutrient density, Digestibility
Raw feeding - biologically appropriate raw food diet mimicking ancestral nutrition
Whole food nutrition - using real, minimally processed foods instead of synthetic supplements
Pet food label reading - understanding ingredient lists, guaranteed analysis, and marketing claims
Nutritional supplements - targeted additions like omega-3s, probiotics, and joint support
Scope of practice - provide nutrition guidance without diagnosing conditions or replacing veterinary care
clientExamples: Pet parents frustrated with recurring allergies, skin issues, or digestive problems
Dog and cat owners who want to transition from kibble to whole food or raw diets
People who lost a pet and want to do better for their current or next fur baby
Pet parents with picky eaters who refuse commercial food
Those spending hundreds on vet visits for issues that could be nutrition-related
practiceType: Pet nutrition consulting focused on species-appropriate feeding, whole food nutrition, label reading education, and customized feeding plans for dogs and cats
